U.S. Shutdown, Assuming It Doesn’t Run Long, Will Slow, Not Cripple Crypto Efforts https://www.coindesk.com/policy/2023/09/25/us-shutdown-假定-it-doesnt-run-long-will-slow-not-cripple-crypto-efforts/?utm_medium=referral&utm_source=rss&utm_campaign =头条新闻RISP6F3E7ZBUZEX2M7IY2GYMFI Jesse HamiltonThe crypto industry’s business in Washington is coming to a head just as a looming congressional budget impasse could shut down an array of federal services next week. But the digital assets sector can expect its most important matters won’t go entirely dark, experts suggest, even if they’re dragged out longer than crypto firms had hoped. Mon, 25 Sep 2023 20:14:25 +0000 2023-09-25T20:27:05.405+00:00 Policynews_analysisAnalysisShutdownCongresslitigationETFsbitcoin spot ETFCourt Casestop newsRepublicans in the House of Representatives may force a government shutdown that could slow down crypto's U.S. progress. (Jesse Hamilton/CoinDesk)杰西·汉密尔顿
